title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp changed 'little details' to turn Reds into winners
text:

Liverpool defender Dejan Lovren has revealed how boss Jurgen Klopp changed the 'small details' to turn the Reds into serial winners.

Klopp's tactics, his inspirational management and the signing of key players such as Virgil van Dijk, Mo Salah and Sadio Mane are all reasons why Liverpool are champions of Europe and top of the Premier League by six points.

But centre-half Lovren reckons some of the little things the manager changed - from saying 'good morning' to everyone to cleaning their table - have also been instrumental in fostering a culture of excellence at Liverpool.

On Sunday Liverpool host Tottenham - the first opponents Klopp's Reds came up against after he took charge at Anfield four years ago declaring he would 'turn doubters into believers'.

"Four years already? I'm getting old," said Lovren when asked about that statement. "Yes, we started to believe when he said 'From doubters to believers'.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

"He changed things in the club, from small details like saying 'good morning' to everyone to cleaning your table.

"We are, I think, raised at my age that when you see an older person you will say 'Good morning'. It is about respect.

"When you have this outside of the pitch you will feel it also on the pitch. It is the simple things.

"It is about things like the food; he brought in people who are the best in these positions, and he knows what he is doing.

(Image: Getty Images)

"I think some part of these details are missing in some clubs."

Liverpool and Tottenham last met in June's Champions League final, where Klopp's men won their sixth European Cup, but the two sides' respective fortunes have taken different paths since then.

The Reds are unbeaten in the Premier League, with eight wins and a draw giving them a six-point advantage over defending champions Manchester City at the top of the table.

Tottenham, by contrast, trail by 13 points having registered just three league wins so far.

(Image: REUTERS)

Lovren said it shows getting to the top and staying at the top are two different things and that can be seen in how the two squads have developed since that meeting four years ago.

Of the Liverpool squad which was named for that goalless draw only Nathaniel Clyne (currently injured, otherwise he would have been transferred out), James Milner, Adam Lallana and Divock Origi remain at the club.

By contrast Spurs still have Huge Lloris, Danny Rose, Tony Alderweireld, Jan Vertonghen, Erik Lamela, Dele Alli, Christian Eriksen, Michel Vorm, Ben Davies and Harry Winks.

Essentially, little has altered personnel-wise at the club.

(Image: Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty I)

"It can change quickly. Three or four years ago we didn't have the best start," Lovren added.

"With the improvement, the belief, with the work of the team you can achieve anything. This is what Klopp told us.

"The most difficult part is when you are on top to stay on the top. When you sometimes drop it is about showing your inner strength, it is about the character of the team to jump back.

"I think we learned about all our mistakes from previous years. I think we are on the right path.

"He (Klopp) said to us it is exceptional that we lost the final against Real Madrid and we came this year and won it. It says a lot about the team."
description: Dejan Lovren has explained how Klopp changed the culture at the club to start the journey towards being European champions and Premier League pacesetters
